name: Paneer Lababdar
history: Paneer Lababdar is a popular North Indian dish, often found in the menus of Indian restaurants. It is a rich and creamy curry made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese), known for its indulgent texture and flavor.
description: Paneer Lababdar is a delectable vegetarian dish made with soft paneer cubes simmered in a creamy, spicy, and tangy tomato-based gravy. It's often garnished with cream and served with Indian bread or rice.

instructions.title: Prepare the Onion-Tomato Mixture
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until onions turn golden. Add tomato puree, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.

instructions.title: Blend Cashews
instructions.description: Soak cashews in warm water for 10 minutes and then blend to a smooth paste.

instructions.title: Cook Paneer
instructions.description: Add the cashew paste to the pan. Cook for a few minutes. Add paneer cubes to the gravy and cook for another 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream
instructions.description: Add cream and garam masala to the pan. Stir well and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Make sure the cashew paste is smooth to ensure a creamy texture.
Adjust the amount of green chilies and red chili powder to suit your taste.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or bell peppers for added nutrition.
For a vegan version, use tofu instead of paneer and coconut cream instead of dairy cream.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, topped with a swirl of cream or butter.
Pair with a tangy mint chutney or a side salad.
